alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 3:51PM PDT until August 24 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, with rainfall rates of one half inch per hour. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California in Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 545 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas and poor drainage areas is expected. Some low water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Los Angeles, Llano, Saddleback Butte State Park and Highways 18 and 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
